[b][color=white]Extended HF Downtime on Saturday[/color][/b]
On Saturday, we experienced about 12 hours of downtime. The outage was caused by an Apache failure on the server. As it was a holiday weekend, [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1][color=#FF66FF][b]Omniscient[/b][/color][/url] was out with his family so he was unable to fix the server remotely. Everything is resolved and he has stated he will put in more automated checks to prevent this from happening in the future. To read more about the downtime, check out [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1][color=#FF66FF][b]Omniscient's[/b][/color][/url] thread: [url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=4325485][b]Downtime July 6[/b][/url].

[b][color=white]Official Group Infamous Up for Sale[/color][/b]
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=4066][color=#9999FF][b]Judge Dredd[/b][/color][/url] is selling his Official Group, Infamous, for a total of $18,000.00 USD. The payment options available are bank wire, Western Union, or BTC. There is a limited amount of official groups and currently can only be purchased from an existing group owner. If you've got the cash and want to own a group on Hackforums, head over to [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=4066][color=#9999FF][b]Judge Dredd's[/b][/color][/url] thread: [url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=4316258][b]Official Group | Infamous For Sale 18k / WU/BTC/BANK TRANSFER *Revised*[/b][/url].

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=651337]Tibit[/url] is looking for a graphics artist to make his new usergroup, Phoenix, which include a userbar, banner, and forum icon. [b][color=white]Omnicoin Services Thriving[/color][/b]
Despite the downturn in price, developers are releasing amazing apps and websites to support and provide knowledge about the Omnicoin economy. The economy is constantly evolving and changing with new apps debuting on nearly a daily basis. Keep an eye out for more awesome apps from developers on HF.

[b][color=white]Omnichain.info Temporarily Shut Down[/color][/b]
In response to [b][url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1256441]Abraham Lincoln[/url][/b]'s partner [b][url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1231915][color=black]ʜᴜʀʀʀ[/color][/url][/b]'s suspicious actions including a [url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=4321614]$200 scam report[/url] and unexpected one month vacation ban, Abraham Lincoln elected to take the site offline temporarily to ensure user data and stored Omnicoins stay safe. This followed a suspicious request to reset the server password that was delivered to Abraham Lincoln's email that was possibly from ʜᴜʀʀʀ or another malicious party. Abraham Lincoln assured users that all data and funds are safe and that he will be working to provide a way for users to retrieve any stored OMC from their wallet. Until then, the site will remain down.

[color=deepskyblue][size=large][font=Monotype Corsiva]Interview[/font][/size][/color] [color=white][size=large][font=Monotype Corsiva]-[/font][/size][/color] [size=large][font=Monotype Corsiva][url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=530032]Fade™[/url][/font][/size]
[spoiler=]
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1653635][b][color=#DDA0DD]Clark:[/color][/b][/url] Welcome to the HF news. Today we're joined by fellow Writ3r "Fade". How goes it Fade? Do you have any shout-outs?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=716927][color=#EFEFEF][b]Fade™:[/b][/color][/url] Hey Clark, thanks for having me. All is well, down in Florida for vacation this week. Shoutout to Matt, Oblivious, ItsATumor, Vurezo, along with the rest of the OMC chat. Also Cyph Jr for being my bitch, and BlackVeilBrides for making me a l33t hax0r.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1653635][b][color=#DDA0DD]Clark:[/color][/b][/url] Right on right on. Now, you're responsible for creating the new Headlines for the 200th editions correct?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=716927][color=#EFEFEF][b]Fade™:[/b][/color][/url] That's correct man, Sir put me into the group to do headers for the News and I was immediately put on the spot for the 200th edition. Hope they turned out well and everyone liked them.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1653635][b][color=#DDA0DD]Clark:[/color][/b][/url] I think you did a KICKASS job man, seriously they really spruce up the new editions. Where did you learn how to design?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=716927][color=#EFEFEF][b]Fade™:[/b][/color][/url] Thanks man! Glad you liked them. I started designing about 2 and a half years ago and I'm completely self taught. I learned everything from YouTube videos, online tutorials, and just basic trial and error kinda stuff.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1653635][b][color=#DDA0DD]Clark:[/color][/b][/url] Can designing be assumed your passion now?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=716927][color=#EFEFEF][b]Fade™:[/b][/color][/url] Yeah I guess you could call it that. It's definitely something I really enjoy, but I've become very busy lately with my online projects and my job IRL, so it's kind of become something I do every now and then when someone needs to purchase graphics from me.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1653635][b][color=#DDA0DD]Clark:[/color][/b][/url] Oh I see. What do you do for a living?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=716927][color=#EFEFEF][b]Fade™:[/b][/color][/url] Well considering I'm only 16, there's nothing I do full-time. I work offline and online so I guess you could consider those both part-time jobs. Besides that, in my free time I'll hang out with my friends or girlfriend or go to the gym and work out.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1653635][b][color=#DDA0DD]Clark:[/color][/b][/url] So you're also into Web Development too huh? Awesome. How long have you been doing that?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=716927][color=#EFEFEF][b]Fade™:[/b][/color][/url] That's right. I've been working with web development for about a year now. It's not something I'm all that experienced in, but it's very interesting to me and something I want to learn more about.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1653635][b][color=#DDA0DD]Clark:[/color][/b][/url] Cool, which language are you working on -- if any at the moment?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=716927][color=#EFEFEF][b]Fade™:[/b][/color][/url] Just learning the basic HTML and CSS. Most of the clients I get work with Wordpress which is a CMS (content management system) so there is little to no coding involved.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1653635][b][color=#DDA0DD]Clark:[/color][/b][/url] Yeah I got you. Since you've been registered with HF, what's the one thing that has kept you coming back?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=716927][color=#EFEFEF][b]Fade™:[/b][/color][/url] Probably the unique community. Since there are so many people on HF, you get a little bit of everything. From design, to computing, hacking, the marketplace (where I spend a lot of time), and much more. There's just a huge variety that keeps everyone satisfied.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1653635][b][color=#DDA0DD]Clark:[/color][/b][/url] HF has been down for the better part of the day; are you dying to get back on?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=716927][color=#EFEFEF][b]Fade™:[/b][/color][/url] Yes I want it back up,  but I'm not too concerned. Since I'm in Florida I've been occupied most of the day, but I'd like for it to be back up soon that's for sure. What do you think of all this "FBI seize" talk that's going around?

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1653635][b][color=#DDA0DD]Clark:[/color][/b][/url] It's a troll created by lonely bored virgins. Anyway, I'd like to thank you for joining us today; any last words?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=716927][color=#EFEFEF][b]Fade™:[/b][/color][/url] I agree, and last of all thanks again for having me. Hopefully HF will be back up soon.
[/spoiler]

[color=deepskyblue][size=large][font=Monotype Corsiva]Interview[/font][/size][/color] [color=white][size=large][font=Monotype Corsiva]-[/font][/size][/color] [size=large][font=Monotype Corsiva][url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=530032]Curt.[/url][/font][/size]
[spoiler=][b][url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1148878][color=#FFA500]Clique:[/url][/b][/color]  Hi there Curt, welcome to this weeks edition of the news. How are you doing? Anyone you'd like to give a shoutout to before we begin?
[color=white][b][url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=530032]Curt.[/url]:[/b][/color] Hey there Clique! I'm doing pretty good man, you? and I'd like to give a shout out to myself and all my home dawgs

[b][url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1148878][color=#FFA500]Clique:[/url][/b][/color] Doing just fine dude man. Tell us a little about yourself -- what does Curt do when he's offline? What do you do when you're online? Do you sell things?
[color=white][b][url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=530032]Curt.[/url]:[/b][/color] Well, i'll keep this brief. I'm 19 years old and work full time. I'm a huge gaming enthusiast and also a huge football (soccer, for you Americans) fan. When i'm not on HF i'm usually at work or hanging out with friends or at the gym. If im not doing that you can usually find me on the Xbox playing Call of Duty. When I'm online? I just tend to lurk alot lately but you can usually find me in the Lounge posting here and there. I have sold numerous things on HF in the past but not anymore, I tend to stay away from the marketing scene now.

[b][url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1148878][color=#FFA500]Clique:[/url][/b][/color] Sounds like you're always busy doing things -- which is good! Are you more of a console player or a PC or die type of gamer? Also, have you started your summer break?
[color=white][b][url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=530032]Curt.[/url]:[/b][/color] Yeah I guess you could say that. I'm a console gamer for sure, although I do play the odd PC game, Minecraft for instance. Nope, I finished college last year so I don't get a summer break unfortunately.

[b][url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1148878][color=#FFA500]Clique:[/url][/b][/color] Well that's a shame. What brought you to Hackforums? Was it through a friend or did you discover the site on your own?
[color=white][b][url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=530032]Curt.[/url]:[/b][/color] Aye. Well its quite a long story but i'll keep it short for the sake of the interview. I was a member of another forum for over a year and came across a thread about Cybergate a 'RAT' which at the time, I had no idea about. So I was intrigued about this and did a bit of searching in Google and came across a tutorial on HF which was posted by the member 'Plutonium' if I remember correctly. It required me to sign up so I did, I read the tutorial and set me up a Cybergate. I then left HF and went back to the other forum I was a member of. I later on that week went back to HF due to me learning about Darkcomet a more advanced RAT and since then, never looked back. Theirs alot more to it than this but this is a vague explanation of what brought me to HF originally.

[b][url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1148878][color=#FFA500]Clique:[/url][/b][/color] Are you still into the whole scene of RATs? I've always been interested in how they work and what they can do, but never really got involved with them.
[color=white][b][url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=530032]Curt.[/url]:[/b][/color] Nope, not anymore. Haven't used one for a long time now. I do still help people in the Remote Administration Tools Section from time-to-time, though.

[b][url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1148878][color=#FFA500]Clique:[/url][/b][/color]  What's your opinion on the prices of groups? JD is currently selling his group, Infamous, for around $18,000. Do you think that groups are an investment or a waste of money?
[b][url=http://hackforums.net/member.php=action=profile&uid=530032]Curt.[/url]:[/b] Well, I see it as a profitable thing if im honest although the prices to purchase one has increased drastically over the months, for obvious reasons. Once you own a group though theirs plenty of ways you can profit from it. Take Infamous for example, its one of the highly rated groups which everyone wants to be apart of. Charging buy-ins, selling group products the profitable possibilites are endless. So no imo they aren't a waste of money so long as you know what you're doing.

[b][url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1148878][color=#FFA500]Clique:[/url][/b][/color] Could you see yourself owning one with another member, or at all in the future? I personally couldn't see myself dishing out that much for a group, unless it was divided up with a few members.
[color=white][b][url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=530032]Curt.[/url]:[/b][/color] At this moment in-time I don't see myself owning one, no. I agree with you though, its a lot of money for anybody to go solo buying one but as you said, with a few members it wouldn't be so bad, but you're still paying a large sum of money just to share ownership, so its a bit of a weird one, I guess.

[b][url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1148878][color=#FFA500]Clique:[/url][/b][/color] Very true. After all the years that you've spent on the site and changes that it's been through, can you see yourself continuing to be active in the future?
[color=white][b][url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=530032]Curt.[/url]:[/b][/color] Yes, of course! I see myself being active on HF for the foreseeable future.

[b][url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1148878][color=#FFA500]Clique:[/url][/b][/color] That's great. If you had the opportunity to change one thing on the forum, what would you change?
[color=white][b][url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=530032]Curt.[/url]:[/b][/color] To be honest their isn't much I'd change, Omni's doing a pretty good job thus far. Although their for sure is one thing, I would really love the old theme back.

[b][url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1148878][color=#FFA500]Clique:[/url][/b][/color] Agreed. The old school theme was pretty nostalgic. Any final words before we wrap this interview up?
[color=white][b][url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=530032]Curt.[/url]:[/b][/color] I would like to thank you for taking your time interviewing me. Along with the rest of the news team for there effort week in week out on doing what they do for HF. Also anybody who wants to know more, feel free to ask. I'm a chill guy. PEACE OUT.[/spoiler]

[color=deepskyblue][size=large][font=Monotype Corsiva]Interview[/font][/size][/color] [color=white][size=large][font=Monotype Corsiva]-[/font][/size][/color] [size=large][font=Monotype Corsiva][url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1221196]Unknown •[/url][/font][/size][spoiler=]

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=797403][color=#22C997][b]630:[/b][/color][/url] Welcome to 201st edition of the HF News, today we're here with Unknown •. Any shout-outs you'd like to make before we begin?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1221196][color=white][b]Unknown •:[/b][/color][/url] Hello, thanks for having me on the HF News, it's an honor, really. I'd like to give my shout-outs to Aura, Th3PonyWizard, Black Soul, and +Oblivious.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=797403][color=#22C997][b]630:[/b][/color][/url] I interviewed +Oblivious a few weeks back, it was fun. An interesting group of kids, how did you meet them?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1221196][color=white][b]Unknown •:[/b][/color][/url] I met +Oblivious when I became active on HF. I was browsing the Premium Sellers sections and saw his service about writing your name on the body of any girl, and I had some mony to spare so I purchased some pictures from him. After the deal, we talked a bit, and I realized we had a lot in common. We continued to talk, and are pretty good friends now. I met Aura and Th3PonyWizard when I was recruited as a member of The Empire's   General Hacking Sector. Th3PonyWizard was the leader of the sector, and Aura was, for some reason, in the Skype Chat. I talked with both of them, and we started a group on other forums called The Order together. It's also a group on HF, although unofficially. I now help out with Aura and other members of The Brotherhood's Computing sector. As for Black Soul, I met him when I was posting a lot in the lounge on a bored weekend. He seemed like a very intellectual user, and I exchanged some private messages with him about life. I saw that our views on life, and interest were alike. I talk to him on a regular basis, and I always enjoy it.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=797403][color=#22C997][b]630:[/b][/color][/url] Nice! I look at the friends I've met on the forum and it's crazy how people cross paths and become friends over a forum. You're currently in Infamous, Empire, and the Brotherhood, how do you like the groups?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1221196][color=white][b]Unknown •:[/b][/color][/url] I'm pleased with all the groups I'm in. The Empire is highly active, and most people may see us as a good for nothing general discussion group, but I met a lot of friends there. The Brotherhood is group with many members that all have their own skills. It's interesting to talk to different kind of people, such as developers, designers, computing fanatics and coders. Infamous is currently being sold, but JD must have his reasons. I joined Infamous when it was still Complexity, it was the 2nd group I joined after Instinct. I really enjoy my time there, and I've also made friends there, and I've learned a lot from other members.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=797403][color=#22C997][b]630:[/b][/color][/url] I saw that Judge Dredd had Infamous for sale, do you think he will actually sell the group? How do you feel about the possible sale of the group?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1221196][color=white][b]Unknown •:[/b][/color][/url] Infamous will most likely sell, but I don't think it will be sold any time soon. The amount of people on HF with the privelege to invest 18k in a group is limited. And since Dredd won't sell it to members who already own a group, you can narrow the number down to a really small amount of people. I have had a lot of laughs and debates in Infamous, but everything eventually comes to an end. I'd need to get used to not being in there, but it wouldn't affect me on a big scale since I can still talk with the members.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=797403][color=#22C997][b]630:[/b][/color][/url] I thought that 18k was a little steep personally, but it's going to be interesting to see how it boosts prices of other groups. So tell me a little about yourself, what do you do outside of the forum?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1221196][color=white][b]Unknown •:[/b][/color][/url] Outside the forum I play a lot of piano. I've been playing the piano for 6 years now, but I'm starting to lose interest slowly. I used to watch a lot of anime, and still do, but due to time constraints I have watched a smaller amount of episodes lately. I also game with friends, mostly FIFA 14, GTA V, and Minecraft when playing with friends. When I'm alone I mostly play Assassin's Creed, history has always interested me, and that's probably why Assassin's Creed is so amusing to me.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=797403][color=#22C997][b]630:[/b][/color][/url] Nice! What console do you game on?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1221196][color=white][b]Unknown •:[/b][/color][/url] I play on PS3. I can get a PS4 or Xbox One if I want one, but none of my friends currently own one, so I'd be pretty lonely.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=797403][color=#22C997][b]630:[/b][/color][/url] I'm in the same boat. I have a PS3, but none of my friends go on PS4 so I haven't made the switch yet. When you do make the switch which console will you pick and why?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1221196][color=white][b]Unknown •:[/b][/color][/url] I'm most likely switching in October. Assassin's Creed: Unity will be released on the 27th of October, and it's for next-gen consoles only. Most of my friends will be switching in November/December. It's highly likely tjhat I'll purchase the PS4, I've always used Sony systems, aside from the Nintendo 64.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=797403][color=#22C997][b]630:[/b][/color][/url] I'm going to be holding out until they stop making the Call of Duty series for the PS3 and then I'm forced to switch. So how did you end up finding Hack Forums?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1221196][color=white][b]Unknown •:[/b][/color][/url] I found HackForums when I wanted to start coding. I learned Batch and Python, but I stopped learning coding languages and moved on to Computing.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=797403][color=#22C997][b]630:[/b][/color][/url] I couldn't ever grasp coding, html destroyed me. Is computing just a hobby or is it something you want to do long term?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1221196][color=white][b]Unknown •:[/b][/color][/url] It's something I enjoy doing, and I'm considering studying it to do it for a living. I learned HTML when I was 11, but I'm not really into Web Development.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=797403][color=#22C997][b]630:[/b][/color][/url] Wow, that's impressive. How would you rate your overall Hack Forums experience on a scale on 1-10?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1221196][color=white][b]Unknown •:[/b][/color][/url] I'd rate my overall HF experience a 9/10. Staff does their job properly, and I've had some chat with admins too. They're pretty nice. I've met a lot of friends on HF to whom I talk daily, and it really kills time. I'd be pretty bored without HF. The bad part is that it distracts me from studying sometimes, haha.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=797403][color=#22C997][b]630:[/b][/color][/url] If you could change one thing about the forum what would it be?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1221196][color=white][b]Unknown •:[/b][/color][/url] That would be the themes. I really liked the old school theme, and I have no problem with the modern styled themes, but I can just visualize so many good looking themes.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=797403][color=#22C997][b]630:[/b][/color][/url] It was a tough time because I like the old theme so much, but I finally made the switch. I wish there were more colors to choose from, a black theme would be nice. Well that's all the time we have for this interview, do you have any concluding remarks you'd like to make?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1221196][color=white][b]Unknown •:[/b][/color][/url] Thanks again for having me on this interview. The last thing I'd like to say is: If you're getting bored of HF, and aren't in any usergroups, they're the place for you. I've had times when I considered quitting HF, but usergoups always entertained me.[/spoiler]

[color=deepskyblue][size=large][font=Monotype Corsiva]Interview[/font][/size][/color] [color=white][size=large][font=Monotype Corsiva]-[/font][/size][/color] [size=large][font=Monotype Corsiva][url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=393774]Shark[/url][/font][/size]
[spoiler=][url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=952870][color=#2E64FE][b]Alien:[/b][/color][/url] Welcome to the 201st edition of the HF News, today we're here with Shark. Any shout-outs you'd like to make before we begin?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=393774][color=#EFEFEF][b]Shark:[/b][/color][/url] Hey everyone! I'd like to give a shout-out to the Brotherhood BHCPU group and also to the Infamous group. Specifically Aura, Cyph Jr., Freddy Krueger and Mike!

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=952870][color=#2E64FE][b]Alien:[/b][/color][/url] You have been a member on HF since 2010. How much has changed for you since you first joined the site to where it is today?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=393774][color=#EFEFEF][b]Shark:[/b][/color][/url] Hack Forums has changed quite a bit since 2010. Back in 2010, we used to have a ton of hacking sections where users could actually discuss BH topics. As time progressed, I've seen a lot more scammers on the site and also a rise of lot of more intelligent users. A lot of my good friends sadly, have turned to the scamming side and are no longer apart of the forum. However, I personally love HF and my mindset and morals have maintained since 2010.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=952870][color=#2E64FE][b]Alien:[/b][/color][/url] It's good to hear you haven't changed your ways. Did you partake in black hat activity when you first started?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=393774][color=#EFEFEF][b]Shark:[/b][/color][/url] Actually I did a little bit. Back in 2010, I joined because my partner suggested this site to advertise my modded lobbies for the Xbox 360. Upon doing that I received tons of funds but my partner actually stole the funds. With the help of the community, I actually received my funds again and to later find out that he was trying to infect me and steal my money. Once that happened, I branched off into the White Hat Help section and have been there since.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=952870][color=#2E64FE][b]Alien:[/b][/color][/url] I, too, joined HF years ago due to the Xbox 360 but that was for another reason which was Gamertag sales. Did the experience you described inspire you to learn and get more interested in security?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=393774][color=#EFEFEF][b]Shark:[/b][/color][/url] Absolutely!People directed me to the HJT section to get the malware removed (now known as MRT). After that, I private messaged members that were helping out in the WHH area and asked them to guide me and built a huge relationship with people in that area. Where I stand currently includes taking courses on security at another forum and also taking a computer science course along with an intro to IT course.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=952870][color=#2E64FE][b]Alien:[/b][/color][/url] It is great to hear success stories like this come from experience on Hack Forums. Tell us about the service/website you run in your signature: Make Me Famous.
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=393774][color=#EFEFEF][b]Shark:[/b][/color][/url] Make Me Famous launched Christmas day and has been running since. MMF aims to provide social media services and website design at a cost friendly price. I offer various amount of services for all the major platforms. While people assume I compete with the pricing on site, I do not. I compete on a global level and compete with companies outside of HF. I absolutely love MMF and it has given me hands on experience with the business world and I love it.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=952870][color=#2E64FE][b]Alien:[/b][/color][/url] I agree it can be difficult to compete with others in the Hack Forum's Marketplace. You have had a lot of experience in different groups on HF. How do you feel about the current groups today as well as how much more valuable they've become in the past couple of years?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=393774][color=#EFEFEF][b]Shark:[/b][/color][/url] Well after leading one group on HackForums, I've been placed with this high expectation mindset that very few groups have achieved. I personally believe that groups have really degraded since the old days. While people may claim their group is the best or produce the most "quality", I disagree. Groups really have degraded and I mean, I enjoy them but they aren't what they used to be. I'd like to see more things done with groups and maybe enhance what they can do onsite.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=952870][color=#2E64FE][b]Alien:[/b][/color][/url] I agree to an extent but understand some of the reasons for it. In your personal life you are involved with the Special Olympics. How did that come about and what exactly do you do?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=393774][color=#EFEFEF][b]Shark:[/b][/color][/url] The Special Olympics is something I've always had a heart for and I personally love kids so this works well. I actually volunteer for the Special Olympics of Florida for the Tennis program. I was a former coach for my local country club and have been playing the sport for a few years now. My fathers company goes to a nearby event every year to support them. Basically, I donate money every year (125.00 which is equivalent to funding a full season for one athlete).

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=952870][color=#2E64FE][b]Alien:[/b][/color][/url] That's great to hear. Donating your time and/or money to those in need or for another good cause is extremely rewarding. Does anyone in your personal life know about your membership to HF or do you not really talk about it?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=393774][color=#EFEFEF][b]Shark:[/b][/color][/url] Hack Forums has always played a role in my life and many friends of mine know about it. My family members are also well aware of my membership on HF. I feel that if I pretend to be different and hide it that I'm not being myself. Teachers that I am close to and work with know of my presence on HF and love to hear the knowledge and insight I provide. The IT guy at my school also browses HF along with a few of my computer friends.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=952870][color=#2E64FE][b]Alien:[/b][/color][/url] Looking at the other side of the matter, it certainly feels as though the community of HF has gotten more and more open about their personal life on the site. At the same time, "doxing" seems to be much easier and more prevelant. What are your thoughts on this?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=393774][color=#EFEFEF][b]Shark:[/b][/color][/url] Doxing has always been around and will remain around. Sadly, I believe that this behavior is unacceptable. When users have had their personal data leaked it saddens me to see what others do with this data. In my personal experience, I've come across many doxes online and the one thing I've done if I ever came across personal financial information is report it to the persons email listed or to their card companies.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=952870][color=#2E64FE][b]Alien:[/b][/color][/url] It is quite sad what is happening to some people but that's great to hear what you do to help out. Is there anything we did not discuss today that you would like to before we wrap this interview up?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=393774][color=#EFEFEF][b]Shark:[/b][/color][/url] I just wanted to say thank you again for the interview Alien and I really had a great time with this. I do hope to see some users inspired to pursue security and such like myself. I offer my hand in assistance to any of those who need help with anything and also happy to help those who are interested in the computer science field. Thanks again.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=952870][color=#2E64FE][b]Alien:[/b][/color][/url] You are a true White Hat helper. Thank you for your time and responses & enjoy the rest of your day!
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=393774][color=#EFEFEF][b]Shark:[/b][/color][/url] Alright man thanks again Alien I appreciate it.
[/spoiler]
posts.subject: HF News - 201

posts.message:
[align=center][img]http://i.imgur.com/DRYf5j2.png[/img][/align]

[align=center][b]By [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1124063]BoomShot[/url] & [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1173142]Goodies[/url][/b][/align]
[align=center][spoiler=][align=left]

[b][color=white]Microsoft's Legal Action Against No-IP.com[/color][/b]
As anyone familiar with RATs (Remote Administrative Tools) should know, dynamically maintaining your IP address via a free DNS server (such as the service offered by [url=http://no-ip.com]No-IP.com[/url]) provides the best method for keeping a large number of botnet members connecting to a dynamic IP address whilst maintaining the stability of a single static domain. An estimated 7.4 million compromised Microsoft(R) Windows(tm) machines are infected with malicious programs that use [url=http://no-ip.com]No-IP.com[/url] as a free Dynamic DNS tool. Microsoft has since siezed dozens of domains and subdomains owned by [url=http://no-ip.com]No-IP.com[/url] for neglecting to protect against millions of malware programs infecting users. Microsoft's original plan was to filter out subdomains with known associations to malware while allowing other subdomains to resolve to their intended IP addresses. however, according to [url=http://www.noip.com/blog/2014/06/30/ips-formal-statement-microsoft-takedown/]No-IP’s Formal Statement on Microsoft Takedown[/url], Microsoft's infrastructure was not able to serve its users and millions of users without malicious intent have been denied access due to Microsoft's "draconian actions."

[b][color=white]The Internet's Own Boy - Aaron Schwartz[/color][/b]
Aaron Schwartz, one of the most respected contributors to the internet, a co-creator of RSS (Really Simple Syndication), the co-founder of the website [url=http://reddit.com]Reddit[/url], and a known internet activist, to the dismay of all family and friends, took his own life at the age of twenty-six. True to his passion of freedom of information, Schwartz illegally downloaded, and intended to release, millions upon millions of academic journals from MIT (Massachusetts Institute of Technology). After having been threatened with a 35-year prison sentence and a fine of over $4,000,000, Schwartz thought it best to end his own life before having to suffer in jail until his early 60's. It was, indeed, a sad and tragic event; a film dedicated to the remembrance of Aaron Schwartz and his contributions to the world around us dubbed "The Internet's Own Boy - Aaron Schwartz" is now available for viewing [url=https://archive.org/embed/TheInternetsOwnBoyTheStoryOfAaronSwartz]Here[/url]. Aaron Schwartz will surely be missed and his dedication to the true hacker mindset is one that will not be forgotten.

[b][color=white]Blackphone ~ The Truly Private Smartphone[/color][/b]
Originally intended too keep oneself anonymous from the NSA (National Security Agency), among other secretive government agencies, two companies, Silent Circle and Geeksphone, have developed an anonymous, decentralized smartphone that keeps matters private. The OS featured on Blackphone, dubbed "PrivatOS", features several privacy-oriented improvements such as very limited geo-location allowances, encrypted calls, messages, file transfers, and internet browsing, and privacy-enhanced applications truly give its users the ability to feels safe. However, privacy comes with a price; access to these features (such as encrypted VoIP (Voice over Internet Protocol) and encrypted messaging) costs $10/month. This also comes with a VPN subscription along with other benefits. Though it is currently sold out, the Blackphone is available with 16 GB of on-board storage, a 2.0 GHz NVIDIA Tegra 4i CPU, and 1 GB of RAM for $629 and [url=https://store.blackphone.ch/]may be purchased here[/url].

[b][color=white]Indexeus.org ~ Account recovery & Consultancy made easy![/color][/b]
The controversial website [url=http://indexeus.org]Indexeus[/url], developed by HackForum's own [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1642244]Dubitus™[/url] (et al), has turned some heads in the hacking community. Having been comprised of thousands of leaked databases, [url=http://indexeus.org]Indexeus[/url] likely has some form of information in regards to your passwords, website information, or physical locations. [b][color=white]TOR Users Targeted By The NSA[/color][/b]
According to documents leaked by Edward Snowden last summer, the notorious NSA surveillance program named "X-Keyscore" has been found to contain code that enlists people using anonymity services, such as the TOR network, to a watch list. The leaked information indicates that NSA has the ability to retrieve a person's sensitive information such as his phone number, e-mail address, e-mail inbox, and his entire Internet activity, including his browsing history. According to an NDR (Norddeutscher Rundfunk) report, a rule in the second part of X-Keystroke's source code logs traffic from all visitors to torproject.org. Specialists have noted, however, that behind the leaking of X-Keyscore's source code might not be Edward Snowden but other NSA employees who was inspired by Snowden's actions around revealing the truth. 

[b][color=white]Microsoft Introduces New Webmail Encryption[/color][/b]
Microsoft has announced, last Tuesday, the implementation of stronger encryption for its e-mail services and cloud services and has taken a step forward by activating Transport Layer Security (TLS) encryption to its e-mail services: outlook.com, hotmail.com, live.com and msn.com. Following the aforementioned change, spying outcoming and incoming correspondence of a Microsoft account will be more difficult, as long as TLS is enabled. Matt Thomlinson, the vice president of Microsoft's Trustworthy Computing division, stated that these changes will push governments into using appropriate and legal processes to gain access to data instead of technical brute force. Microsoft has also enabled PFS (Perfect Forward Secrecy) encryption for its cloud storage, OneDrive. The OneDrive website and all other similar tools/software will be using the new encryption standard, which will ensure the protection of a user's confidentiality, even when there are malicious users eavesdropping. 

[b][color=white]Jailbreak Tool For iOS 7.1.2[/color][/b]
A new iOS 7.1.2 jailbreaking tool, under the name "Pangu" has been developed by Chinese hackers was revealed last week. It has been reported that the tool in question is able to perform an untethered jailbreak, which means that you do not have to connect the device to your computer each time you want it jailbroken. According to test ran by specialists, you can upgrade your iOS to version 7.1.2 and still be able to install and use the "Pangu" tool without any complications. What remains a challenge, however, is the ability to hack and jailbreak iOS 8 which is expected to be launched in September.[/align][/spoiler][/align]

[b][color=white]U.S. Suspected Spy Arrested In Germany[/color][/b]
A German male has been arrested for charges of spying for a foreign intelligence. Confirmed by a German official, the 31-year-old man still remains anonymous, but German newspaper Süddeutsche Zeitung, have reported that the agent was spying on behalf of the United States. Tension between the two countries have been high since the leaking of NSA documents revealed that the USA had been monitoring German Chancellor Angela Merkel’s personal phone calls. The White House has refused to comment on the story and an official handout of a phone call between Merkel and President Barack Obama made no mention of the story.

[b][color=white]Former Newspaper Editor Jailed 18-months For Phone Hacking[/color][/b]
Andy Coulson has been jailed for 18-months after he was found guilty for phone hacking. The former [i]News of the World[/i] editor was convicted for "conspiracy to intercept voicemails on mobile phones" after an 8-month trial. The sentence on Friday came exactly three years after The Guardian newspaper released reports on the phone hacking incidents and how staff hacked the voicemails of murdered schoolgirl Milly Dowler, causing widespread controversy. Rupert Murdoch, former owner of the paper, was then forced to close the 168-year-old tabloid just days after the report. It became later known that the newspaper had listened in to many messages of celebrities, victims, and government ministers just to obtain a scoop.

[b][color=white]Palestinians In Uproar Over Teens Death[/color][/b]
Palestine has been in a major conflict this past week due to a suspected revenge killing on a Palestinian teenager. It started when three Israeli teens were found dead on Monday. In suspected retaliation, a Palestinian teenager, Abu Khdeir, was kidnapped and murdered. This has caused an uprising in the community where Israeli police have had to use rubber bullets and tear gas to stop riots and violence spreading. On Friday, a funeral was held for Khdeir in which further violence broke out between police and Palestinians with over 60 people being injured. Israeli police are still investigating the murder and the motive behind it.

[b][color=white]Soaring Fuel Prices in Egypt[/color][/b]
If you think four dollars per gallon is bad, try an extra three. That is essentially what is happening in Egypt right now as fuel prices have soared 70% just weeks after the new Presidential Administration took control. President Abdel Fattah Sisi's cabinet has abolished energy subsidies of up to $24B annually, and as a result outraged citizens are criticizing him for "mobilizing a third revolution." This has become the highest increase in gas prices in 36 years and subsequently electricity prices have been hiked up between 10-50% depending on the level of household usage. These rising utility prices aren't doing any wonders for the nation. As it currently stand,s the nation has an unemployment rate of 13.6% and poverty rate of 26.3% - we can only wait and see if the country will finally stabilize.

Reports have said that separatist tanks and armored vehicles are heading in the opposite direction of the town. This is considered to be the most significant movement within the past few weeks. However, it is undetermined whether the rebels will be able to regroup and continue the push back.

They implied that the addition of the Bitcoin payment option for all global hotel services could be the next step in expanding the service and use. [b][color=white]Bank of Russia: Bitcoin shouldn't be rejected[/color][/b]
Months after the Bank of Russia first broke its silence on Bitcoin and alternative digital currencies with stern warnings relating to their potential treatment under the law, regulators have released new statements that suggest the country is further softening its tone on the topic. The Wall Street Journal has reported that Russia's central bank is currently in the process of gathering information about Bitcoin and other forms of digital currency. Earlier in 2014, the Russian central bank issued a warning affirming that the use of Bitcoins and alternative "money substitutes" is prohibited in the Russian Federation, which in turn caused a widespread fear globally that Russia was seeking to ban its use. Georgy Luntovsky (Bank of Russia, Deputy Chairman) has hinted that the Bank of Russia is currently taking a "wait-and-see" approach to the Bitcoin regulation; a move that would prove cogent to other jurisdictions likewise.

[b][color=white]Litecoin Price continues to Slump[/color][/b]
Litecoin is facing its biggest value slump in its existence. Once Litecoin went mainstream, it closely followed Bitcoin's typical extreme value swings -- peaking at $40 in late 2013, shortly after Bitcoin passed the $1,000 mark. However, in less than just two months, Litecoin has lost that close relationship with Bitcoin, prompting community members and few business leaders to question Litecoin's viability. Litecoin seemed to be connected with Bitcoin in some way when the value of Bitcoins slumped last December as a result of the very fact that most exchanges offered solely LTC/BTC conversions. However, Bitcoin started recovering this April, while Litecoin did not as it continued staying flat and trading within the $9-$12 range. The first half of May saw an uncommon period of stability for both coins, but Bitcoin once again started rallying in the second half of the month, and Litecoin was left behind, hovering at the $10 mark before dropping to single digits in the middle of June. The negative trend continued throughout June and Litecoin experienced a giant slump on July 1, 2014. Litecoin was down over 10% in a mere 24 hour period. To all intents and purposes, Litecoin is on its own, having lost it's relationship with Bitcoin, and worse yet, it's clearly in trouble.

[b][color=white]Tim Draper Purchases All 29,656 Bitcoins From U.S. Marshall Auction[/color][/b]
Tim Draper, founder of Draper Fisher Jurvetson (DFJ), an American Venture Capital firm, won the auction for the whole lot of the Silk Road seized coins. At about 7:39 PM GMT on Tuesday, July 1st, the coins were transferred from [url=https://blockchain.info/address/1Ez69SnzzmePmZX3WpEzMKTrcBF2gpNQ55]USMS-controlled wallet[/url] to the [url=https://blockchain.info/address/1a8LDh3qtCdMFAgRXzMrdvB8w1EG4h1Xi]winning bidder's wallet[/url]. Draper stated that he plans on investing the coins into Vaurum, a "robust Bitcoin exchange for financial institutions." There were a total of 45 bidders in the auction, with Draper coming out on top; many people have stated that this is a very good sign. There were 44 wealthy losers in that auction, all who now have an unsatisfied thirst for thousands of Bitcoins.

[b][color=white]European Banking Authority (EBA): Risks of Virtual currencies "Outweigh Benefits"[/color][/b]
The European Banking Authority (EBA) recently published a report "addressed to the EU Council, European Commission and European Parliament setting out the requirements that would be needed to regulate 'virtual currencies.'" Obviously this is no surprise, seeing how Bitcoin is a major threat to banks and other financial institutions, but the EBA might have just crossed the line when stating, "As an immediate response, the EBA therefore advises national supervisory authorities to discourage credit institutions, payment institutions and e-money institutions from buying, holding, or selling virtual currencies." The report goes to outline a total of 70 'risks' including "risks for users, market participants, risks related to financial integrity, such as money laundering and other financial crimes, and risks for existing payments in conventional (so-called fiat) currencies."

[b][color=white]The Five Legged Kangaroo![/color][/b]
Scientists at the University of Colorado at Boulder unveiled Kangaroos using their tails similar to their legs. Scientists discovered that the propulsive force of the tail was equivalent to the propulsive force of all four legs of the kangaroos. Some argue that the amount of mechanical work performed by their tails may be more than the work performed by human legs. According to Maxwell Donelan, the tail acts as an additional leg because the tail has over twenty vertebrae. The complexity of their tails is similar to the role human pedestals; the tail simulates the foot, calf, and thigh bones. 

[b][color=white]Insect Diet for Bigger Brains?[/color][/b]
Scientists at the University of Washington in St. Louis have been trying to discover how primitive humans thrived with such little knowledge. In fact, scientists have now come to the conclusion that primates and earlier humans may have had higher cognitive levels than the modern day human. Slugs and hard-to-reach insects have been proven to increase brain capacity, and as a result, scientists believe this would have lead to the evolution process in humans. The main stimulation of the brain came from primates digging and searching for these lean sources of protein; nowadays humans put forth minimal efforts to reach said products.

[b][color=white]The Advantages Present at Higher Elevations[/color][/b]
Several thousand years ago, ancestors of the Han migrated to a low oxygen environment - the Tibetan plateau. The dangerously low oxygen content proved fatal. However, the Denisovans, a special type of human-like species, inherited genetics allowing them to adapt accordingly. Specifically, the Denisovans had a variant of the hemoglobin regulation gene, allowing for the immune system to prevent heart disease and other internal problems due to oxygen abstinence. This gave the Denisovans a cardiovascular edge. Eventually, the Denisovans passed on these genetic traits to the Tibetans - or the ancestors of the Han. This is one of the several reasons why the Tibetans were able to survive in an environment such as the Tibetan plateau, where the Tibetans had a stronger immune system and therefore could prevent cardiovascular prone diseases. 

[b][color=white]Elephant Shrew Discovered[/color][/b]
Scientists discovered a new mammal in deserts of Namibia called [i]Macroscelidea micus[/i]. The newly discovered elephant shrew is said to weigh an ounce and measure 7.5 inches. This little critter can easily be looked at as a rodent, but they just aren't. Researchers state that these elephant shrews mainly give birth to twins or triplets, and they aren't sure why this species of elephant shrew are more closely related to elephants than mice. 

[b][color=white]Humans Hate Boredom[/color][/b]
Scientists from the University of Virginia conducted a psychological experiment where participants were to be in a empty room with nothing except their own thoughts for 15 minutes. The participants were also given a device containing a 9 volt battery to shock themselves on their will. The results surprised the researchers with 6 out of 24 women shocking themselves. However, 12 out of 18 men used the device. Researchers said that men used the device 190 times within those 15 minutes on average, but they excluded this data from the final analysis. They hypothesize that men are more willing to take risks than women.
[/align][/spoiler][/align]

[b][color=white]Preventing Pancreatic Cancer[/color][/b]
Cancer Research UK has helped discover some new information on one of the most deadly forms of cancer. By donating £6 million, with plans to double that contribution, the organization has funded the research that has helped discover that up to 40% of cases of pancreatic cancer can be attributed to one's lifestyle. They suggest that factors such as obesity and smoking have had large impacts on the rates of pancreatic cancer, and by controlling these factors, one can reduce chances and possibly prevent cases. Their continued donations are made in hopes of prolonging survival rates from this deadly disease.

[b][color=white]A Revolution in Mental Healthcare[/color][/b]
A major flaw in today's health care systems is how professionals deal with mental health issues. Tel Aviv University researchers have planned to change this by developing a smartphone app designed to help physicians keep tabs on patients with mental illness. The software runs in the background of a patient's phone and collects information such as the frequency of sending texts, phone calls, and the checking one's phone, for example. These details are transmitted to the physician, who can look for indicators of mental illnesses. The patient's privacy is, according to the university, top priority.

[b][color=white]Vaccine Safety[/color][/b]
A huge concern in society is the safety of vaccines, amplified in part by celebrities vowing an "all natural" way of raising their children. A systematic review of a large volume of literature published in the journal [i]Pediatrics[/i] has determined vaccines to be safe, carrying a low risk of serious side effects. The review analyzed 67 research papers from a pool of 20,000 and found that serious side effects are very rare, and do not include autism or cancer. The publication brings light to the growing issue of anti-vaccination advocates, which have helped bring back to the world the issue of preventable diseases.

[b][color=white]The Link Between Physical and Financial Health[/color][/b]
Researchers at Olin Business School at Washington University in St. Louis have found evidence for a link between physical and financial health. The team found that people who contributed to a 401k retirement plan were 27% more likely to act to change behaviors that negatively impacted their health. A lack of retirement funds and chronic poor life choices were found to also be linked. The study suggests that financial responsibility and health-conscious behaviors are strongly correlated. 

[b][color=white]The Dangers of ADHD Medication[/color][/b]
With the rise of ADHD and related diagnoses, a growing number of people are being medicated on stimulants. As a result, much research has been dedicated to studying the side effects of these medicines. Researchers at Aarhus University have discovered that common ADHD medications, such as Ritalin and Concerta, place the user at a doubled risk for cardiac problems. However, the researchers also suggest that the risk is still low, and patients who benefit from the drugs should be monitored more carefully instead of taken off the drug.

[b][color=white]Tackling Breast Cancer[/color][/b]
Being one of the most common and deadly types of cancer, significant research has been dedicated to breast cancer. A team of specialists from QMUL have made a great breakthroughs in one of the most aggressive forms of this cancer. Their research shows that the αvβ6 molecule exists in high concentrations in severe cases. By introducing an αvβ6 antibody known as 264RAD, the team managed to shrink tumors and reduce the spread to other areas of the body. The next proposed step is to determine the most effective time to introduce this antibody and prolong survival.
[/align][/align][/spoiler]

[b][color=white]Being Positive in the Wrong Way[/color][/b]

At the start of the new NFL season Jordan will have to sit the games out. Coach Joe Philbin has stated that Dion has been training and getting ready for the new season. "We were disappointed to learn about Dion's suspension," Philbin said. "Dion has accepted responsibility for his actions and is committed to improving, both on and off the field, in preparation for the upcoming year." In 2013, Jordan was the third pick in the draft out of Oregon. Dion's goals have been to continue working on his speed, his weight, and effort within the game to improve his play style. While Jordan cannot participate in actual scheduled games, he is allowed to play in preseason games and take part in the training camp.

After speaking out to the media, Donovan states that the match was definitely a struggle and the players tried their best. “I think we’re all disappointed in what happened yesterday," Donovan said. “I think the most disappointing is we didn’t seem like we gave it a real effort, from a tactical standpoint. I thought the guys did everything they could, they did everything that was asked of them, but I don’t think we were set up to succeed yesterday, and that was tough to watch.” During the middle of May, Donovan was cut from the list of players who would participate in the U.S. squad for the World Cup. news edition advanced alot. This edition was really special, so as 
soon as i logged in i opened up and started reading. I like how

HF it a city/state and news are reporting for events occurred.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2020818][i]-KeyLoggingPro[/i][/url][/align]

[i]"I haven't been on HackForums for a long time, therefore I had 
to check some older editions to get an impression of how the HF 
News developed and I have to admit, they did a lot. Seeing that 
people put so much work into something, for such a long time, 
including steady improvements in each edition, feels amazing. It 
makes me feel proud of being a part of such a community! But 
enough of my sentimental side, I really like the style of the 
graphics, it is clean and simple, but it still stands out. I listened 
to the whole podcast as soon as I saw the thread, whoever had 
the idea, should get a cookie, it's amazing!"[/i]
